intro: Hieracium × obornyanum subsp. stricticaule, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, where it thrives in full sun. Its subspecies status reflects genetic variation within the broader Hieracium genus, contributing to its adaptability and ecological significance.
